#summary Getting started


 # Download a copy of gwt-phonegap.jar and place it inside your classpath
 # Add the following line to your .gwt.xml file: {{{<inherits name='de.kurka.phonegap.PhoneGap' />}}}
 # Since gwt-phonegap is only tested on iPhone and Android you can tell GWT to only cimple for safari: {{{<set-property name="user.agent" value="safari" />}}}
 # Starting phonegap example: [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-phonegap/source/browse/trunk/gwt-phonegap-showcase/src/main/java/de/kurka/phonegap/showcase/client/ShowCaseEntryPoint.java]
 # if you are running on Android add the following code to your html host page:

 <script type="text/javascript">
    	document.addEventListener("deviceready", (function(){ PhoneGap.available = true;}), false);
    </script>

You may want to take a look at the [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-phonegap/source/browse/trunk/gwt-phonegap-showcase/ ShowCase] app to see how GWT-Phonegap is used:
